column3: IIUC this doesn't let us detect problems with clean shutdowns?

> IIUC this doesn't let us detect problems with clean shutdowns?\n\n@promag Thanks for the question, I forgot to address this point indeed. There are many tests that stop/start nodes cleanly _during the execution_. If we want we can even create a dedicated test to verify proper node shutdown. This change only affects the procedure when we shutdown test environment _after the test_ itself is perf
How does this interact with sanitizers that check for problems during shutdown?
> There are many tests that stop/start nodes cleanly _during the execution_.\n\nTrue. Anyway, I'd rather see improvements on clean shutdown, ~2% "speedup" is not worth IMO.
-0, if the gains aren't huge I don't think it's worth the squeeze. Although I agree that we shouldn't be counting on test ends to be testing clean shutdown behavior.
